title: In Defense of Pure 16-bit Floating-Point Neural Networks. (arXiv:2305.10947v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Reducing the number of bits needed to encode the weights and activations of neural networks is highly desirable as it speeds up their training and inference time while reducing memory consumption. For these reasons, research in this area has attracted significant attention toward developing neural networks that leverage lower-precision computing, such as mixed-precision training. Interestingly, none of the existing approaches has investigated pure 16-bit floating-point settings. In this paper, we shed light on the overlooked efficiency of pure 16-bit floating-point neural networks. As such, we provide a comprehensive theoretical analysis to investigate the factors contributing to the differences observed between 16-bit and 32-bit models. We formalize the concepts of floating-point error and tolerance, enabling us to quantitatively explain the conditions under which a 16-bit model can closely approximate the results of its 32-bit counterpart. translated_title: 关于纯16位浮点神经网络的辩护
translated_abstract: 减少编码神经网络权重和激活所需的位数是非常可取的，因为它可以加快神经网络的训练和推理时间，同时减少内存消耗。因此，这一领域的研究引起了广泛关注，以开发利用更低精度计算的神经网络，比如混合精度训练。有趣的是，目前不存在纯16位浮点设置的方法。本文揭示了纯16位浮点神经网络被忽视的效率。我们通过提供全面的理论分析来探讨造成16位和32位模型的差异的因素。我们规范化了浮点误差和容忍度的概念，从而可以定量解释16位模型与其32位对应物之间密切逼近结果的条件。这种理论探索提供了新的视角。
tldr: 本文探讨了纯16位浮点神经网络的被忽视的效率，提供了理论分析来探讨16位和32位模型的差异，并可以定量解释16位模型与其32位对应物之间的条件。
en_tdlr: This paper defends the efficiency of neglected pure 16-bit floating-point neural networks by providing comprehensive theoretical analysis on the differences between 16-bit and 32-bit models, formalizing the concepts of floating-point error and tolerance, and quantitatively explaining the conditions under which a 16-bit model can closely approximate the results of its 32-bit counterpart.
